intro: Aster oblongifolius var. angustatus, commonly known as narrow-leaf aster, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It features slender, angular stems that are often hairy, and its leaves are elongated, lance-shaped, and have a narrow, pointed tip. The plant produces small, clustered flower heads in shades of white to pale blue, typically blooming in late summer to early fall. Its foliage is often covered in fine, soft hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks.
